Comment: I will absolutely acknowledge that Harris was the better choice in this past election and that everyone concerned about the genocide in Palestine should have voted for her over Trump.   However, Harris's handling of the genocide was still very poor. There wasn't a Palestinian speaker at the convention and Harris didn't make even minor gestures or acts of support towards the interests of pro-Palestine groups. She also infamously stated that she wouldn't change a thing from Biden's presidency/policies. She actively campaigned with the Cheneys and took the support of Neocons associated with the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Her campaign sent Bill Clinton and Ritchie Torres to Michigan to basically lecture Muslim voters into voting for her.   I think the evidence suggests that Biden is one of the most Zionist/pro-Israel voices in the Democratic Party and has been so for decades. I don't believe that Harris has that level of commitment to the Zionist cause and perhaps was slightly more movable on issues like a permanent ceasefire, banning offensive military aid, and working towards a two-state solution. However, let's be clear that the genocide in Gaza is incredibly morally reprehensible and Harris's handling of it and the people protesting it during her time as VP and then her campaign was been very, very lacking and cannot be dismissed as a source of legitimate anger among much of the Democratic base.
